description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows authentication information disclosure vulnerability (CVE-2024-38254), apply the relevant updates based on your Windows version:

1. Download the appropriate KB update package from the following links:
   - Windows 11 Version 24H2: [KB5043080](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043080)
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5043076](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043076)
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5043076](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043076)
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5043067](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043067)
   - Windows 10 for x64-based Systems: [KB5043083](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043083)
   - Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems: [KB5043083](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043083)
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5043064](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043064)
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2: [KB5043064](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043064)
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2 (32-bit): [KB5043064](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043064)
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2 (32-bit): [KB5043064](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043064)

2. Install the downloaded updates on your system.
3. Restart your device to ensure all changes take effect.

**Details**:
This update addresses the information disclosure vulnerability impacting Windows authentication. It is crucial to apply the correct updates based on your specific OS version to mitigate potential risks. Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
